info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 13 at 4:00PM PDT until August 13 at 4:45PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM PDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL IMPERIAL AND RIVERSIDE COUNTIES... At 400 PM PDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 15 miles west of Palo Verde, or 33 miles southeast of Desert Center, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Imperial and Riverside Counties. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
